metadata.title: ટ્રાન્ઝિસ્ટર  નાનો ઘટક, મોટી ક્રાંતિ   ડિજિટલ યુગનો પાયો

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: Namaskar, welcome to the show.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: Today we are going to talk about a small but powerful incident.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: Transistor.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: It has changed modern technology.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: We have a good source which will explain how it was discovered, how it works and why it is so important.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: Our aim is to understand how this small thing is used in 20th century research.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: So let's get into it.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: Let's start with the basics.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: What is a transistor?

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: The source says that it is a semiconductor device.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: It has three terminals.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: It is used to amplify or shut down the signal.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: Like a switch.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: Yes, you are right.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: It has a small door for electricity.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: But it is very powerful.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: It is the main part of all electronics.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: It has a small input signal.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: It can control many output signals.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: It is very easy to switch it on and off.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: How interesting is the story of its discovery?

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: Bell Labs, Ognis and Suratalis, Bardin, Brayton and Shockley.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: The source says that they were trying to make a field effect transistor, FET.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: But by mistake, or by accident, they found a point contact transistor.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: Yes, it is a miracle.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: And they got a Nobel Prize for it.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: Yes, in physics.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: At that time, it was difficult to make FET.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: But they found the real success when they understood how a semiconductor works.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: And that's how the first working transistor was made.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: And interestingly, a scientist named Lilienfeld patented the idea of FET.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: But it was not made.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: And at the same time, in Europe, Matare and Velker worked independently in this direction.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: So, the idea was there, but the real work was done in Bell Labs.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: And then at the end of the 50s, MOSFET came.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: That too from Bell Labs.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: The source says that today this is the most used transistor.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: Why?

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: What is so special about it?

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: Its main thing is scalability.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: It can be made at a very small scale.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: And at the same time, it uses less electricity.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: And the second transistor, the bipolar junction transistor, can fit more in a small space.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: It is called a higher density.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: This is how integrated circuits were made.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: That means ICs, chips, right?

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: Yes, right.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: Chips were made possible.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: Today, there are millions, billions, and billions of transistors on a small chip.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: Today's computers, smartphones, everything is thanks to this MOSFET.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: It is the foundation of the digital revolution.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: There is a number in the source.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: By 2018, approximately 13 sextillion MOSFETs had been made.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: 13 sextillion!

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: Oh my God!

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: After 13, 21 are zero.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: Zero!

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: This is beyond imagination.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: So how does this large number of MOSFETs work?

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: In simple language.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: Source says two main things.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: Switching and amplifying.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: Absolutely.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: Switch is the basis of digital logic.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: Either it is switched on, so it lets the current flow.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: Like a switched off switch.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: Or it is switched off, so it stops the current.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: Like an open switch.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: This is the one and zero of a computer.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: And like an amplifier, as we discussed earlier, a small, thin input signal controls a large output signal.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: This is very important in radio and audio.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: Source also says that BJTs are controlled by current, while FETs by voltage.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: This is a technical difference, which is why they are used in different places.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: Yes, I understand.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: But what was the first thing that transistors came with?

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: Source mentions a vacuum tube.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: Yes, vacuum tube.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: It was of that era.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: But it was big, made of glass, so it was thin.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: And it used a lot of electricity.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: It was also very hot.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: Transistors solved all these problems.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: Small, strong, reliable, and it needed less power.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: This is how pocket radio was made.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: Small computer was made.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: And all the technology we have today, became possible.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: Although, it is true that for some special work, like high power or high frequency, vacuum tubes are still used.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: So, the whole story ends with a small incident, which was a bit of a miracle, which changed the world of electronics and our lives.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: Yes, it changed it radically.

segments.speaker: Sarah
segments.text: The ability to make a small switch and amplifier in such a cheap way, and in such a large number, is the basis of the modern era.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: Research is going on.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: Graphene, carbon nanotube.

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: If today's transistor made such a big change, then how will the new revolutionary event of the future be?

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: And how will it change our world?

segments.speaker: Dr. James
segments.text: It is worth thinking about.
